intro: Pelecyphora missouriensis, commonly known as the Missouri bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It produces distinctive seed pods that are inflated and often contain a single seed. Pelecyphora missouriensis is typically found in moist soils along streambanks and in prairie habitats.
